page.title: 03"Bowcombe"-Cheverton Farm 1.
page.content: {Cheverton Farm}comprises about 550 acres of chalky downland typical of this area. The present owner, who has held the land for about fifty years, already has two further generations following in his footsteps. Like the other farms in the area; arable farming is combined with the husbanding of sheep and cattle. Unlike the others, however, the hilly nature of the land poses special problems, which necessitate the use of special equipment such as "crawler" tractors and three wheeled motorcycles for ease and safety of working and getting from one part of the farm to another. Over the years the owner has devoted considerable effort to reclamation of some of the more rugged areas of his land; a continuing process facilitated by the developments in agricultural machinery and technology referred to.
